microsim.title: ADDIE Workflow Interactive Model
microsim.description: Interactive visualization of the ADDIE instructional design model showing the five phases (Analysis, Design, Development, Implementation, Evaluation) and their iterative relationships. Users can click phases to explore details and see how designers cycle through the process.
microsim.subject: Instructional Design
learning_objectives: Identify the five phases of the ADDIE instructional design model
Explain the purpose and key tasks of each ADDIE phase
Understand that instructional design is an iterative process
Recognize when to cycle back to earlier phases based on findings
prerequisites: Basic understanding of educational content creation
microsim.author: Intelligent Textbooks Project

controls.name: Phase Nodes
controls.description: Click on any of the five colored circles to view detailed tasks for that phase

controls.name: Show Iteration Arrows
controls.description: Toggle display of arrows showing how designers can return to earlier phases

controls.name: Show Task Checkboxes
controls.description: Display individual tasks within each phase as checkable items

controls.name: Animate Flow
controls.description: Start/stop animation showing progression through ADDIE phases

controls.name: Reset All
controls.description: Reset all selections and animations to initial state

controls.name: Animation Speed
controls.description: Control the speed of the flow animation

assessment_suggestions: Ask students to identify which phase specific tasks belong to
Have students describe scenarios requiring iteration back to earlier phases
Request examples of how each phase would apply to a specific project
Ask students to sequence the phases and explain the rationale
extension_activities: Compare ADDIE to other instructional design models (SAM, Agile)
Create a detailed project plan using ADDIE for a specific learning objective
Analyze case studies showing successful and unsuccessful use of ADDIE
Develop checklists for each phase customized to your content area

accessibility.described_content: Interactive ADDIE workflow diagram with clickable phases showing Analysis, Design, Development, Implementation, and Evaluation

references: Branch, R. M. (2009). Instructional Design: The ADDIE Approach. Springer.
Morrison, G. R., Ross, S. J., Morrison, J. R., & Kalman, H. K. (2019). Designing Effective Instruction (8th ed.). Wiley.
Dick, W., Carey, L., & Carey, J. O. (2014). The Systematic Design of Instruction (8th ed.). Pearson.
